column1: in memory of marjorie nell dupree -- laughlin service funeral home| first: last: born: july 12
column3: 2015. memorial donations may be made to: holmes street united methodist church building fund
column7: al 35801. this memorial provided by:laughlin service funeral homehuntsville
column13: passed away friday. mrs. dupree worked as a bookkeeper at chambers bottling company where she met her husband
column14: raymond edward dupree. they were married 53 years until his death in 2006. she was a longtime member of holmes street united methodist church where she taught sunday school for many years
column15: was an active member of united methodist women and sang in the choir. she was a faithful fan of all the activities of her children and grandchildren and loved them dearly. she was a great seamstress and loved her arts and crafts. she was predeceased by her husband
column22: al and marie burns (david) of huntsville
column23: al; eight grandchildren; and one great-granddaughter. visitation will be from 11:00 to 12:00 noon monday at laughlin service funeral home. the funeral service will follow at 12:00 noon at the funeral home chapel with rev. eddie johnson officiating. burial will be in maple hill cemetery. in lieu of flowers
column24: memorials may be made to holmes street united methodist church building fund
